Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph P Weldon was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and complete Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance of $1050.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF73.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF73 and 15TR1209:
CO: RMW, REP: Deiss, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph P Weldon appeared. Case called at 2:24 p.m. ADA Nieskes states recommendations and the agreement. Atty Harrelson in agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CF73. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 4th in 15CF73. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 & 3 in 15CF73 and 15TR1209 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. BAC.212. Defendant makes statement. Crt orders:

- S/W 3 years probation. 300 days conditional jail time. 5 days jail credit and credit for good time. Huber granted for work.

- Fine in the amount of $1,800.00. Pay over the course of probation

- 3 years drivers license revocation

- 3 years IID 

-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment and complete drivers safety plan

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-    Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Plea hearing at 10-02-2015 02:00 pm
